meanings.definition: The practice of communicating by telegraph.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used telegraphies to send messages quickly over long distances.
meanings.sent2: The telegraphies were buzzing with news of the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The telegraphies were so busy, they started having their own conversations!
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a network of telegraphies, transmitting thoughts at lightning speed.
meanings.sent5: The telegraphies crackled with urgency, carrying vital information across the country.

meanings.definition: The messages or information transmitted by telegraph.
meanings.sent1: The telegraphies contained news from faraway places.
meanings.sent2: He received the telegraphies with mixed emotions.
meanings.sent3: The telegraphies whispered secrets to each other in the night.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt heavy as he read the telegraphies bearing bad news.
meanings.sent5: The telegraphies painted a vivid picture of life beyond the horizon.

meanings.definition: The technology or system used for telegraph communication.
meanings.sent2: Learning about the telegraphies was fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The telegraphies seemed to have a mind of their own, connecting people across vast distances.
meanings.sent4: The telegraphies hummed with the power of connectivity.
meanings.sent5: The telegraphies wove a web of information, linking cities together.
